path: answers-db/books/Topology Without Tears/4. Homeomorphisms/4.3 Non-Homeomorphic Spaces/3/(iv)

attr.q: Deduce that X is not homeomorphic to any interval.
attr.a: For (i), (ii), (iii) have covered (0,1), [0,1], [0,1) which are homeomorphic to every intervals in the form of [a,b], (a,b), [a,b), (a,b], (-\infin,a), (-\infin,a], (a,\infin), [a,\infin), (-\infin,\infin). By Remarks 4.3.4, we only got \{a\} left to proove. X can't have bijective relation with singleton set.
